thread.title: Facebook Suspends Some 200 Apps in Data-Abuse Investigation - WSJ

author: Maria Armental
title: Facebook Suspends Some 200 Apps in Data-Abuse Investigation - WSJ
text:
Facebook Inc. has suspended some 200 applications for suspected misuse of users’ information shared on or through Facebook, the company said Monday.
The apps, which Facebook didn’t name, are among thousands Facebook has examined so far in an investigation of outside developers.
The company began the probe after reports that Cambridge Analytica,... RELATED VIDEO The Key to Understanding Facebook's Current Crisis Facebook's current data crisis involving Cambridge Analytica has angered users and prompted government investigations. To understand what's happening now, you have to look back at Facebook's old policies from 2007 to 2014. WSJ's Shelby Holliday explains.
